1.title: Week 1: Network Fundamentals Part 1
reading: 1.1 Explain the role and function of network components
1.2 Describe characteristics of network topology architectures
1.3 Compare physical interface and cabling types
labs: Identify different network components
Practice configuring different topology architectures
Explore different cabling types and their uses
tips: Understand the differences between various network devices like routers, switches, and firewalls.
Familiarize yourself with common topology architectures.
resources: Cisco Packet Tracer for lab simulations

2.title: Week 2: Network Fundamentals Part 2
reading: 1.4 Identify interface and cable issues
1.5 Compare TCP to UDP
1.6 Configure and verify IPv4 addressing and subnetting
labs: Configure IPv4 addresses and practice subnetting
Troubleshoot cable issues and recognize collision/errors
tips: Practice subnetting exercises regularly.
Understand the differences between TCP and UDP.

3.title: Week 3: Network Fundamentals Part 3
reading: 1.7 Describe private IPv4 addressing
1.8 Configure and verify IPv6 addressing and prefix
1.9 Describe IPv6 address types
labs: Configure IPv6 addresses
Practice configuring private IPv4 networks
tips: Get comfortable with IPv6 concepts, as it's increasingly relevant.
Learn the different IPv6 address types.

4.title: Week 4: Network Fundamentals Part 4
reading: 1.10 Verify IP parameters for Client OS
1.11 Describe wireless principles
1.12 Explain virtualization fundamentals
1.13 Describe switching concepts
labs: Set up a basic wireless network and configure wireless encryption
Verify IP configurations on different OS (Windows, Mac, Linux)
tips: Understand wireless encryption standards and their differences.
Familiarize yourself with MAC address tables.
resources: Packet Tracer labs for switching concepts

5.title: Week 5: Network Access Part 1
reading: 2.1 Configure and verify VLANs spanning multiple switches
2.2 Configure and verify interswitch connectivity
2.3 Configure and verify Layer 2 discovery protocols
labs: Configure VLANs and interswitch connections using trunk ports
Set up and verify Cisco Discovery Protocol and LLDP
tips: Understand VLAN tagging and trunking concepts.
Use Cisco Packet Tracer for VLAN practice.
resources: Lab exercises on VLANs and trunking

6.title: Week 6: Network Access Part 2
reading: 2.4 Configure and verify EtherChannel
2.5 Interpret basic operations of Rapid PVST+ Spanning Tree Protocol
2.6 Describe Cisco Wireless Architectures and AP modes
labs: Configure EtherChannel and practice troubleshooting
Experiment with different Spanning Tree Protocols and configurations
tips: Understand the role of STP in preventing loops.
Practice EtherChannel configurations on Packet Tracer.

7.title: Week 7: Network Access Part 3 & Review
reading: 2.7 Describe physical infrastructure connections of WLAN components
2.8 Describe network device management access
2.9 Interpret the wireless LAN GUI configuration
labs: Practice managing network devices via SSH, Telnet, HTTP, HTTPS
Explore wireless LAN configurations through GUI
tips: Use a Cisco device emulator to get familiar with WLAN GUIs.
Understand the different management access methods.
resources: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Configuration Guide

8.title: Week 8: IP Connectivity Part 1
reading: 3.1 Interpret the components of a routing table
3.2 Determine how a router makes forwarding decisions
labs: Analyze routing tables and understand how routers make forwarding decisions
tips: Pay attention to routing protocol codes and their meanings.
Understand administrative distances.
resources: Routing and Switching Essentials by Cisco Press

9.title: Week 9: IP Connectivity Part 2
reading: 3.3 Configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 static routing
3.4 Configure and verify single-area OSPFv2
labs: Set up OSPFv2 and static routing for both IPv4 and IPv6 networks
tips: Practice different routing scenarios.
Understand the differences between OSPF and static routing.

10.title: Week 10: IP Connectivity Part 3 & Review
reading: 3.5 Describe the purpose, functions, and concepts of first hop redundancy protocols
labs: Configure and verify first hop redundancy protocols like HSRP, VRRP, and GLBP
tips: Understand how FHRP works and where it's used in networks.
Test different scenarios using GNS3.
resources: Network Lessons on HSRP, VRRP, and GLBP

11.title: Week 11: IP Services
reading: 4.1 Configure and verify inside source NAT using static and pools
4.2 Configure and verify NTP operating in client and server mode
4.3 Explain the role of DHCP and DNS within the network
4.4 Explain the function of SNMP in network operations
labs: Set up NAT, NTP, DHCP, and DNS configurations on routers and switches
tips: Understand the differences between NAT types.
Configure NTP and test its synchronization.

12.title: Week 12: Security Fundamentals Part 1
reading: 5.1 Define key security concepts
5.2 Describe security program elements
5.3 Configure and verify device access control using local passwords
5.4 Describe security password policy elements
labs: Configure device access controls and implement security measures
tips: Always use strong, unique passwords for device access.
Familiarize yourself with security concepts.
resources: Network Security Basics by Cisco Press

13.title: Week 13: Security Fundamentals Part 2
reading: 5.5 Describe IPsec remote access and site-to-site VPNs
5.6 Configure and verify access control lists
5.7 Configure and verify Layer 2 security features
5.8 Compare authentication, authorization, and accounting concepts
labs: Practice configuring VPNs and setting up ACLs for different scenarios
tips: Understand how ACLs filter traffic in the network.
Practice configuring site-to-site VPNs using GNS3.

14.title: Week 14: Automation and Programmability Part 1
reading: 6.1 Explain how automation impacts network management
6.2 Compare traditional networks with controller-based networking
6.3 Describe controller-based, software-defined architecture
labs: Explore Cisco DNA Center and other automation tools
tips: Get familiar with automation and scripting concepts.
Understand the differences between traditional and software-defined networks.

15.title: Week 15: Automation and Programmability Part 2 & Final Review
reading: 6.4 Explain AI and machine learning in network operations
6.5 Describe characteristics of REST-based APIs
6.6 Recognize the capabilities of configuration management mechanisms
6.7 Recognize components of JSON-encoded data
labs: Practice API-based configurations and network automation scripts
tips: Understand how RESTful APIs work.
Practice writing and reading JSON data.
